titleStmt.title: An account of the government of the Christian church for the first six hundred years by Samuel Parker.
titleStmt.author: Parker, Samuel, 1640-1688.

notesStmt.note: "Particularly shewing I. The apostolical practice of diocesan and metropolitical episcopacy. II. The usurpation of patriarchal and papal authority. III. The war of two hundred years between the bishops of Rome and Constantinople for universal supremacy."
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
